channel.title: Because there are 1000's of things to remember
channel.description: Recent content on Because there are 1000's of things to remember

item.title: About
item.description: This is a site for my blog posts

item.title: Blog posts ... tjoef tjaf
item.description: Yup, don’t have time to muck around. Need to be able to blog about things I learn so that I can use them later. Assumptions Your blog Hugo metadata and all that junk lives in ~/somedir/blog/ If not, then you can use hugo to create a new site in ~/somedir as follows In what follows, all my blogs live in ~/WorkDocs/cloudfundis/blog on my PC, and my githubpages repo is in ~/WorkDocs/cloudfundis/cloud-fundis.

item.title: Visual Code Studio and Scala
item.description: This week I am setting up my new laptop - moving off Mac finally and back onto Linux - YAY. So one of the things I’m getting working is Visual Code Studio and Scala. Sounds easy doesn’t it? Step 2 Scalameta is the extension for Scala on vscode. Install it; but wait, that’s not all - there’s more. Of course you went for Step 1 which was “aaah, this is easy, just download the extension and you’re done.
